Selected Answer: BD
Explanation: 
Leading indicators are:
 - Input oriented: These measure the progress made on the inputs or actions required to achieve a desired goal.
 - Easy to influence: The team or person responsible can see the impact of their efforts daily. (D.)
 - Hard to measure: Data required for these indicators are often not collected, so they can be hard to measure without a conscious effort to collect data.
 - Prospective: These help evaluate the future performance on goals. (B.)

Source: https://www.servicenow.com/content/dam/servicenow-assets/public/en-us/doc-type/success/quick-answer/leading-indicators.pdf

Selected Answer: BD
https://www.servicenow.com/content/dam/servicenow-assets/public/en-us/doc-type/success/quick-answer/leading-indicators.pdf

FROM SERVICENOW: 
What is knowledge article versioning in Servicenow?
The Article Versioning feature allows knowledge contributors to create multiple versions of a knowledge article. They can create a new version of an article from an existing published version. This existing version can be either the latest published version or an older outdated version.

Business-to-business (B2B) model
In the business-to-business (B2B) model, an account is a supported external customer and a contact is an employee of that account. With the B2B model, you can support accounts and contacts and also set up:
C and D are correct, but since D (account) is the supported external customer and C (contact) is an employee of D (account), then D is most correct.
